channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [LOG4J2-834] ThrowableProxy throws NoClassDefFoundError
item.description:
In method loadClass we expect ClassNotFoundException. But if class comes from another java machine we can get NoClassDefFoundError.

Possible fix:

private Class<?> loadClass(final ClassLoader lastLoader, final String className) {
       // XXX: this is overly complicated
       Class<?> clazz;
       if (lastLoader != null) {
           try {
               clazz = Loader.initializeClass(className, lastLoader);
               if (clazz != null) {
                   return clazz;
               }
           } catch (final Throwable ignore) {
               // Ignore exception.
           }
       }
       try {
           clazz = Loader.loadClass(className);
       } catch (final ClassNotFoundException | LinkageError ignored) {
           try {
               clazz = Loader.initializeClass(className, this.getClass().getClassLoader());
           } catch (final ClassNotFoundException | LinkageError ignore) {
               return null;
           }
       }
       return clazz;
   }

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: LOG4J2-832 says that an Error can be thrown, the fix there is to catch Throwable but this is not easy to test without hard coding a dependency on a sun. class.

Also, in general, please submit a patch file in unified diff format, preferably with a unit test.

Thank you!
Gary

I'm having a hard time figuring out why this actually happens. But I've tried with the 2.1-SNAPSHOT from http://repository.apache.org/snapshots and it still doesn't work. But the artifacts also seem to be old... Should I use a different maven repo?
The best way to get the latest code and test this is to git clone the repo and do a local build.
Hi. I encountered this bug this morning and cooked-up this patch, with a test case built-in.
When I apply the patch, the ForceNoDefClassFoundError class file is not created, can you attach the source please? Also did you patch against the latest from git master?

I did the following steps to build the patch:

  • git clone http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/logging-log4j2.git
  • created a branch named after this issue, git checkout -b LOG4J2-834
  • create two java files, an interface InexistentInterface.java, and a class which implemets it, ForceNoDefClassFoundError.java
  • compiled the two and run `main` from ForceNoDefClassFoundError, which throws a RuntimeException and serializes it to base64 format
  • copied only the class file for ForceNoDefClassFoundError to the test resources directory, so that it`ll be available at test runtime, but also be unloadable, because of the absence of InexistentInterface in the classpath.
  • create the java test case, ensuring that it throws NoClassDefFoundError
  • fix the bug and run the test case again, confirming it.
  • commit
  • create patch using: git format-patch master --binary

Sorry for not given enough clarification earlier.

I added a test for this ticket just like the one attached in the patch. This is already fixed but we show with this test that the use case from the JIRA is handled. Please build from git master and try again.

I also just pushed a 2.2-SNAPSHOT build to the SNAPSHOT repo (https://repository.apache.org/content/repositories/snapshots/), you can try that too and report back here please.

Thank you,
Gary
Not fixed yet, the test org.apache.logging.log4j.core.impl.ThrowableProxyTest.testStackWithUnloadableClass() is failing.

Cant open a new issue, dont know why.

Still an issue in 2.2

log4j2 classes tries to load classes which makes "static" blocks to run.

Out pattern is the following:
[%d] [%-5p] [%t] [%c] - %m%n

How can we avoid this one for now?

According to docs, there is not any info there related to "location info"?

Or is there?
